bug.author: SheharyarTkxel
bug.summary: Jupyter spawning stuck at scheduling pod due to insufficient cpu
bug.description:
Issue: Tried to spawn a notebook with these specs when it ran into an error stating "1 Insufficient cpu, 2 Insufficient nvidia.com/gpu": Image (standard): gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/tensorflow-1.8.0-notebook-cpu:v0.5.0 CPU: 1 Memory: 2.0Gi Extra Resources: {"nvidia.com/gpu": 1} The YAML template used: apiVersion: eksctl.io/v1alpha5 availabilityZones:
us-east-2a us-east-2b us-east-2c kind: ClusterConfig metadata: name: kubeflow-aws region: us-east-2 version: "1.12" nodeGroups: desiredCapacity: 2 instanceType: t3.large maxSize: 2 minSize: 1 name: cpu-nodegroup volumeSize: 30 availabilityZones:
us-east-2a desiredCapacity: 0 iam: withAddonPolicies: autoScaler: true instanceType: p2.xlarge labels: k8s.amazonaws.com/accelerator: nvidia-tesla-k80 maxSize: 5 minSize: 0 name: tkxel-V100 volumeSize: 50
Let me know what is needed to be changed. Environment:
Kubeflow version: v0.5-branch
